comment: She makes the material interesting and you can tell she cares.

Was a pretty good professor overall but covered material too fast. Lots of homework outside of class as well as participation in discussion. If you don't attend class or discussion, it's a pretty hard class to get a good grade in. I recommend taking the time to read the textbook and pay attention during lectures although they are quite boring.
She was good at her job and you could tell she knew her material. Good at lecturing and giving examples. Her lectures can be boring but if you doze off you may miss material.

Nice but the lectures are very boring. Cancels class quite frequently. The material isn't the easiest, but she puts lots of great resources up online that help with studying and filling in the gaps. Tons of quizzes which aren't too hard since you can just look up the answers. This class covers a whole lot of material and is slightly overwhelming.

This class is not the easiest class but there are so many resources offered online to help you out in this class. Lectures are somewhat helpful but make sure to practice because some of the material is tough. Attendance is not mandatory at all. Overall, not the best class but not the worst class I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Glawtschew is great. Attendance isn't mandatory, and she puts so many practice resources on D2L for you to study, so if you don't at least pass every test, It's because you didn't look over what she provided. There are three tests and ten quizzes, no final (the third test is on final day) and you can get extra credit for every test.

Prof. Glawtschew is a very sweet woman and even though I only went to class four times the entire semester, I still enjoyed her presence. She posts everything on D2L so you don't have to show up but it will mean that you'll have to teach yourself pretty much everything. I would definitely take her again for macro if I could.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Only 3 tests (worth 30% each) and chapter quizzes (10% total), so little room for error. Lots of extra notes, study guides, and practice tests. Some extra credit for the tests. enough to boost your grade a bit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If anyone failed this class or had trouble, it's because they didn't go to class or use the online material. She provides so many ways for you to learn and understand. She goes a little fast and it's a lot of material so it's a little time consuming. She gives extra credit even if its a little. She's willing to help and truly cares for students

8 week summer class, once a week, 6 hour course. 3 exams with extra credit. Not a very easy class but if you study you can make B or A. Study past exams and practice problems. She is very nice and will explain many question you have. You do not have to go to class but one class missed equals 2 weeks of notes in a regular semester, do not skip.

She is a great professor and an awesome lecture. Go to class and pay attention unlike I did and you'll pass. She always has office hours and posts lots of helpful links online to help learn the topics.

She is a GREAT professor. The class is kind of difficult in itself, but she gives so many ways for you to be able to do well. She provides tons of study material, and quizzes, and practice exams (which was an option to earn extra credit) to help you do well. There were four tests, and online quizzes for each chapter.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor. 4 Tests, optional extra credit up to 5 points. Weekly open book and powerpoint quiz. If theres another chance in the future, I would for sure take her again.

4 in class exams and 16 online quizzes. 10 question online quiz almost every week. Lectures come straight from her powerpoints and she posts all her powerpoints online. Easy to pass and not too hard to get an A.

Overall easy class. Teacher is very clear with what she wants and delivers material in a clear concise manner. Attendance isnt mandatory but is recommended. Pay attention in the lectures and you can coast to an A.
I love Dr. G! She made microeconomics really easy to understand. Theres extra credit for every test and the final isnt cumulative. Definitely take her class

The best professor for non-business majors. Her lectures are easy to follow along with and I did fine without buying the textbook. She gives extra credit for every test and the two lowest quizzes are dropped. Attendance is not mandatory, but you should probably go to class. She does her best to make microeconomics easy to understand and "fun".
Great economics professor. Has been teaching for a very long time. Gives extra credit on every test. Very straight forward class. Highly recommend.

Very clear layout on what you need to do to get the grade you want. Still a hard class though, 5 extra credit points for each test if you get all the questions right on the practice exam. Only complaint is she explains concepts to you using words and lingo that only she understands. I don't think she realizes people don't know a lot about econ
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took this class this past summer and really enjoyed it, even though it was 6 hour sessions. For this class, she made an entire packet of notes and it was basically the textbook we used. Very good at explaining the concepts, and makes the class easily doable. Would definitely take again.

I could've passed with more than a C had I payed attention. I went to class, but it was so easy to zone out. That's mostly because she posts literally EVERYTHING on D2L. she gave way too many opportunities to make an A, but I didn't take advantage of that. She's way too nice, so just be respectful in return. 5 tests, optional final, many quizzes

She is a very nice lady but can make some rude or snide comments. She is definitely accesible outside of class. Attendance isn't mandatory but I would suggest going to class. She posts all lectures online. Tests are easy if you study. She posts previous tests & they are very helpful. Office hours help. Weekly online quiz, super easy. Make an A or B
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The quizzes are easy, the tests are okay and the final is optional. Though attendance is optional, I recommend attending the class. She's a great instructor and a quick grader.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: 16 quizzes, all online with the lowest 2 scores dropped. 5 tests with an optional final. Practice tests on D2L for 5 bonus points each test. The optional final replaces your two lowest test scores. I only went on test days. Would have been much easier if I went to class, but just reading the chapters and understanding the content can get you an A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Prof. Glawtschew is great. Lectures are detailed and clear, well paced. Gives literally EVERY opportunity for you to do well in her class (extra credit for doing practice tests, easy online quiz grades, all lectures available for review). If you get a poor grade it's because you didn't attend class or didn't take advantage of these opportunities.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her class, everything seemed very easy especially her test. I felt like I always did good on her test, but when I received my grade, it was always a failing grade. The tests are not hard, but I think she made the answers too tricky. I just did not get her teaching style, and I got and F.

She gives TONS of extra resources for help on D2L (old tests, review documents, etc). 5 tests +optional final, each test has an opportunity to earn 5 points by doing extra credit. Going to class isnt mandatory which is nice, but attending will help your grade dramatically. You have to earn your grade but she makes it as easy as she can.

Great professor. Offers extra credit and dropped lowest exam score. Once you have enough points for an A, you can stop coming to class. Has well put together presentations and clearly knows the material. Would take again!

She is so nice. She puts lectures on d2l aka never went to class. She puts practice tests on d2l which are extremely similar to what her test are like. Take good notes and learn practice tests, and there is no way you will not get an A!! loved her!

Would definitely recommend. You have the chance to get 5 total bonus points on your average, there are four tests (not very difficult, she gives you plenty of study resources),  there is a quiz over every chapter but they are online. If you do the quizzes and practice quizzes, an A is very likely. Take her!!!

Hard class. But all quizzes are online and you should make 100's on them. Can find answers if you google and use quizlet. Gives a practice test for every chapter that adds up to 5 bonus points at the end of the semester. Gives LOTS of supplementary material. ALL POWERPOINTS AND LECTURES ARE ONLINE!!! Don't buy textbook!

I'm currently taking her class for Econ 2100. She does practice quizzes and their solutions, power points, lectures, and an outline of her notes on d2l for EVERY unit. There is no textbook needed. She also puts previous exams from past semesters on d2l to help study. If you master the previous tests, you get an A on your test. She is great & nice!

Very engaging professor. She tries to make the class less boring with her sense of humor but its still econ so its boring. Attendance is not mandatory but I would recommend going because theres so much information you have to know. Gives extra credit, do them and you can get up to 5 extra points on your final grade at the end of the semester.

Just do your work and u will pass her class. She has lots of extra credit quizzes that you should do cause it can pull ur grade up a lot. Econ is no joke there are a lot of stuff u have to learn so showing up for class really helps.

I really liked this professor. She does her best to keep the class light with her sense of humor. However, its micro! So lessons can be boring and difficult. But I think she has a strong grasp of the material a great job. I personally had to attend every class to do well. No textbook needed. Do the extra quizzes every week! You wont regret it.

If you take the time to read the chapters this class is easy. She offers extra credit for every quiz, you can see a PDF of the extra credit quiz before you take it, and you get 3 attempts for the extra credit and 2 attempts for each quiz. She was always friendly and ready to answer questions. She also posts all her powerpoints online.

I'm not sure why she has mediocre reviews, Glawtschew was very helpful, clear with directions, available for extra help through email and in person. She answers her emails quickly and thoroughly. She explains everything down and dirty and is knowledgable. I would definitely take her again.

The previous complaints were likely from bad students who didn't put in the time. Dr. G is an awesome professor, and she wants her students to succeed. She has a fun personality and works with you. We had problem sets; exams were similar. If you want to do well, put in the effort and ask for help if you need it. Econ majors: take her for ECON 4550.

WPRST TEACHER EVER. told us at the beginning of the year that she would drop our lowest test grade, then she changed her mind. had a fire drill during first test, was going to give extra credit... changed her mind. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! everything is weighted the same and little to no extra credit. save yourself!

OMG worst professor I have ever had in four years of college. She reads directly from the powerpoint, expects you to know everything, and counts the HW as 25% of your grade! that is the craziest thing i've ever heard of and i have never had a professor that dumb. she is not helpful and won't budge or give extra credit. she is not a good teacher

SHE IS THE WORST TEACHER EVER!!! 3 tests, study guides that had nothing to do with the tests, boring lectures, the final was 40% of the class grade which is bad for a class that there are no home-works, and not a lot of ways to earn extra credit. Do not pick her if you love yourself.

Very easy class. No textbook needed, just pay attention to the slides she presents and ask her questions if you have any. Lectures are basically reading the slides sometimes, so you don't HAVE to come into class.
Difficult class, very boring lectures. Is nice and helpful, but extremely hard to pay attention with such a boring lecturing style. (You've been warned).

Don't take this class if you don't like ECON or FIN.  Dr. G is awesome, but the material will eat you alive unless math is a strong suit.  Dr. G is organized, helpful, and compassionate.  She cares and wants you to succeed.  Tests are relatively hard, but if you attend class and complete study guide then you will pass.  Loved this class.

If you like this subject and already understand it then this is a good professor for you. She is helpful,however she reads straight from the ppt so you really don't have to go to class. There are 3 test and hw assignments. The test are a bit diffucult.

If you have excellent math skills, this Dr. G is very upbeat and has a great personality. She knows the subject matter very well.  She is more than willing to help with homework. Your homework average counts as 25% of your final grade so take it seriously.  Attendance in not mandatory but highly advisable. You'll enjoy having her as your Professor.

reads straigh from ppts, 2 tests and final, hw is easy. attendance is not a must, just look over ppt and the online resources she puts online and you will at least get a B on the tests. she gives curves and is very helpful. if you don't get something ask her/go to turtoring/read book or you will regret it!
often teaches directly from power point slides.  offers office hours to help with homework and comprehension of materials.
